newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Cathay eyes US$6 bln in planes by 2003.
newsitem.headline: Cathay eyes US$6 bln in planes by 2003.

text.p: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said on Monday it expects to spend up to US$6 billion on aircraft acquisitions for delivery from now until 2003.

The plan represents the second part of Cathay's US$9 billion aircraft acquisition programme aimed at positioning the airline for the opening of the territory's new airport at Chek Lap Kok, spokeswoman Edna Lam told Reuters.
The US$6 billion includes the purchase of 14 aircraft to be delivered in 1998 and 1999, and 25 others Cathay has an option to buy and which are deliverable between now and 2003, she said.
The 14 aircraft are seven Boeing 777-300s as well as one Airbus A330-300 and six A340-300s, she said.
Cathay spent US$3 billion on confirmed aircraft orders for delivery from 1994-97, Lam said.
The airline carried a record 10.99 million passengers last year, up 5.8 percent on 1995, a company statement said.
It carried 568.15 tonnes of freight in 1996, up 6.9 percent on the previous year.
Cathay's fleet grew to 59 aircraft at the end of last year from 57 in January 1996, it said.
